materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 886 Blue A, 311 White B, and 319 Cherry Red C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Measurements: 28" (71cm) at widest point x 14" (35.5cm) at longest point
gauge: 10½ dc = 4" (10 cm); 6 rows = 4" (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BUNTING
With C, ch 4. 
Row 1: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook, (skipped 3 ch counts as first dc) – 6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st across – 12 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, dc in next st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] 5 times – 18 dc. 
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 5 times – 24 dc. 
Row 5: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, dc in next 3 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts] 5 times – 30 dc. 
Continue to increase 6 sts every row as established, working one more st in between each increase for 16 more rows. 
AT SAME TIME, when 8 rows of C have been completed, begin to work in stripe pattern as follows: 
Work 2 rows with B. 
Work 2 rows with C. 
Work 2 rows with B. 
Work 2 rows with C – 96 sts on last row worked. 
Rows 17-20: Change to A, ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across – 96 dc. 
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Edging
Row 1: Turn piece to work along row edges, ch 1, work 80 sc evenly spaced along straight edge to first st of Row 21. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 9 sts, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (tie made), sc in next 30 sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (tie made), sc in 29 sts, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (tie made), sc in last 9 sts. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 360 Café Latte A and 381 Light Blue B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cozy measures 16 (21)” long x 20 (22)” circumference [40.5 (53.5) x 51 (56) cm].
gauge: 10 sts = 3” (7.5 cm); 9 rows = 5” (12.5 cm) in double crochet.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Your precious new bundle of love will be easy to cuddle and will feel secure in this little cozy. We have shown it with blue edging, but pink (or really any color) can be used for your precious baby.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 dc in first st, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 11 times; join with slip st in first st—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 dc in first st, dc in next 3 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts] 11 times; join with slip st in first st—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 dc in first st, dc in next 9 (4) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 (4) sts] 5 (11) times; join with slip st in first st—66 (72) dc. 
Rounds 7–19 (26): Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off. 
Top and Facial Opening 
With wrong side facing, place marker on 23rd (24th) stitch to the right of the seam (if you are right-handed; left of the seam if you are left-handed). 
Row 20 (27): With wrong side facing, join A with slip st in marked st, ch 2 (does not count as a st here or throughout), dc in next 46 (48) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—46 (48) dc. Place marker on end of this row for placement of facial edging.
Rows 21 (28)–29 (39): Ch 2, dc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a 20” (51 cm) tail for sewing. Fold last row in half aligning first and last stitches. Whipstitch stitches together to form top of cozy. Secure end of tail.
Ears (make 2)
Leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail, with A, make an adjustable ring, ch 2 (counts as first dc).
Row 1 (right side): Work 12 dc in ring, ch 2 (counts as last dc), slip st in ring—14 dc. 
Fasten off, leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail for tying ear to top of cozy.
Directions are for size Newborn. Changes for size 3 months are in parentheses.
Bag is made in joined rounds. Top and facial opening is worked back and forth in rows. Bear’s ears are made separately and tied to cozy.
You may find it helpful to wrap the baby in a swaddling blanket before slipping the cozy on.
COZY
Bag
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first st—12 dc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in first st—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 dc in first st, dc in next st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] 11 times; join with slip st in first st—36 dc. 

Row 2: With right side facing, leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail, join B in top of beginning ch, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 12 sts, ch 2 (counts as last hdc), slip st in top of ending ch—14 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail for tying ear to top of cozy.
FINISHING
Facial Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join A with sc in marked row of facial opening, sc in same row as join, 2 sc in each row around to unworked sts of Round 19 (26), sc in each unworked st; join with slip st in first sc—60 (76) sc.  
Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with sc in any st, sc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Ears Place a marker on each side of Row 25 (33). Position each ear on this row at least 5 stitches from facial edging and thread B tails around this stitch to wrong side. Knot tails together tightly. Thread A tails around 3rd stitch (or where desired) behind B tails and knot tightly on wrong side. 
Weave in ends.
RHC0211-019330M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019 BABY BEAR COZY | CROCHET    2 of 2

materials: Size 3.25mm (U.S. D or 3) crochet hook or whichever size hook you require to achieve correct gauge.
abbreviations: 4dcl = (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through 5 loops on hook.
5dcl= (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook.
9dcl= (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 9 times. Yoh and draw through 10 loops on hook.
measurements: ONE SIZE: Fits up to 9 months
instructions:
BACK
With MC, ch 82.
**Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
*Miss next 3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. Miss next 3 ch. 
1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Join A. 
Ch 3. Turn.
1st row: Miss first st. 4dcl over next 4 sts. *Ch 3. 
1 sc in next st. Ch 3. 9dcl over next 9 sts. Rep from
* to end of row working 5dcl over last 5 sts. Ch 3.
Turn.
2nd row:4 dc in first st. *Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc.
Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of 9dcl. Rep from * to end of
row working 5 dc in top of turning ch. Join MC. 
Ch 1. Turn.
3rd row: 1 sc in first st. *Ch 3. 9dcl over next 9 sts.
Ch 3. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row
working 1 sc in top of turning ch. Ch 1. Turn.
4th row: 1 sc in first st. *Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of
9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end
of row. Join A. Ch 3. Turn.
Rows 1 to 4 form pat.**
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 
18 ins [45.5 cm] ending on a 2nd row of pat and
omitting turning ch at end of this row. Fasten off.***
Shape sleeves: With MC, ch 24. With WS of work
facing, join ch to back and work 3rd row of pat
across back sts. Ch 25. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Miss next 
3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch.
Rep from * once more. Miss next 3 ch. 9 dc in next
ch. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next st. **Miss 3 ch. 9 dc
in top of 9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from
** 9 times more. ***Miss next 3 ch. 9 dc in next ch.
Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from *** 
to end of ch. Join A. Ch 3. Turn.
Taking sleeves into pat, work a further 13 rows pat,
thus ending on a first row of pat. Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT: With MC, ch 42.
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 
18 ins [45.5 cm] ending on a 2nd row of pat.
Shape sleeves: Next row: Work 3rd row of pat
across left front sts. Ch 25. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Miss next 
3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch.
Rep from * once more. Miss next 3 ch. 9 dc in next
ch. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next st. **Miss 3 ch. 9 dc
in top of 9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from
** to end of row. Join A. Ch 3. Turn.
Taking sleeves into pat, work a further 7 rows pat,
thus ending on a 3rd row of pat.
Shape neck: Next row: 1 sc in first st. *Miss 3 ch.
9 dc in top of 9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep
from * 6 times more. Break MC. (Note: last 9dcl is
left unworked).
Next row: (WS). Join A to 5th dc of last 9dc group
of previous row. 1 sc in this dc. *Ch 3. 9dcl over next
9 sts. Ch 3. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row
working 5dcl over last 5 sts. Ch 3. Turn.
Next row: 4 dc in first st. *Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next
sc. Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of 9dcl. Rep from * 5 times
more. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in last sc. Break A.
Next row: Join MC to 5th dc of last 9 dc group of
last row. 1 sc in this dc. *Ch 3. 9dcl over next 9 sts.
Ch 3. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row
working 1 sc in top of turning ch. Ch 1. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in first st. *Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of
9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 5 times
more. Join A. Ch 3. Turn.
Next row: Miss first st. 4 dcl over next 4 sts. *Ch 3.
1 sc in next st. Ch 3. 9dcl over next 9 sts. Rep from
* to end of row working 5dcl over last 5 sts. Fasten
off.
RIGHT FRONT: With MC, ch 42.
Work from ** to *** as given for Back.
Shape sleeve: With MC, ch 24. With WS of work
facing, join ch to Right Front and work 3rd row of
pat across Right Front sts. Ch 1. Turn.
Next row:1 sc in first st. *Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of
9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times
more.** Miss next 3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. 
Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from ** twice
more. Join A. Ch 3. Turn.
Taking sleeve into pat, work a further 7 rows pat,
thus ending on a 3rd row of pat. Do not ch 1 for
turning ch. Break MC.
Shape neck: Next row: (RS). Miss last 9dcl and 
ch 3 of previous row. Join MC to next sc. 1 sc in this
sc. *Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of 9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in
next sc. Rep from * 6 times more. Join A. Ch 3.
Turn.
Next row: Miss first st. 4dcl over next 4 sts. *Ch 3.
1 sc in next st. Ch 3. 9dcl over next 9 sts. Rep from
* 5 times more. Ch 3. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in first st. Miss 3 ch. *9 dc in top of
9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Miss 3 ch. Rep from
* 5 times more. 5 dc in top of turning ch. Join MC.
Ch 1. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in first st. *Ch 3. 9dcl over next 
9 sts. Ch 3. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. 
Ch 1. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in first st. *Miss 3 ch. 9 dc in top of
9dcl. Miss 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 5 times
more. Join A. Ch 3. Turn.
Next row:Miss first st. 4 dcl over next 4 sts. *Ch 3.
1 sc in next st. Ch 3. 9dcl over next 9 sts. Rep from
* to end of row working 5dcl over last 5 sts. Fasten
off.
HOOD
With MC, ch 82.
Work from ** to ** as given for Back.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 
7 ins [18 cm] ending on a 3rd row of pat. Fasten off.
Fold Hood in half with WS tog and sew last row tog
at top.
Hood edging: With RS of Hood facing and MC,
work 89 sc along front edge of Hood. Ch 3. Turn.
Next row: (Eyelet row). Miss first 2 sts. *1 hdc in
next st. Ch 1. Miss next st. Rep from * to last st. 1
hdc in last st. Ch 1. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in each st and ch sp to end of row.
Ch 1. Do not turn.
Next row: Working from left to right instead of
right to left as usual, work 1 sc in each st to end of
row. Fasten off.
Cuffs (Make 2 worked lengthwise)
With MC, ch 18.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 1. Turn.
1st row: 1 sc in back loop of each sc to end of row.
Ch 1. Turn.
Rep last row until cuff measures 5 ins [13 cm] when
slightly stretched. Fasten off.
Front Edging
With RS of Left Front facing, work 136 sc along
front edge between neck shaping and foundation
row. Ch 1. Do not turn.
Next row: Working from left to right instead of
from right to left as usual, work 1 sc in each st to end
of row. Fasten off.
Rep for Right Front.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew cuffs to lower sleeve edges
stretching cuff and gathering sleeve to fit. Sew side
and sleeve seams reversing seam at center of cuff for
turn back. Sew foundation row of Hood to neck edge
having Hood edging meet at center front. Thread
twisted cord through eyelet row of Hood edging.
Sew 1 tassel to each end of twisted cord. Sew zipper
in position under front edging. Sew rem center front
seam and lower edge closed.
Twisted cord: Cut 2 strands of yarn 96 ins [244
cm] long. With both strands tog hold one end and
with someone holding other end, twist strands to the
right until they begin to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and
tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will
now twist themselves tog. Adjust length if desired.
Tassel: Cut a piece of cardboard 3 ins [8 cm] wide.
Wind MC around cardboard 25 times. Break yarn
leaving a long end and thread end through a needle.
Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove
cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾ inch
[2 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem
loops and trim ends evenly.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m) Little Mouse (30010) 4 balls
Size U.S. 6 (4 mm) circular knitting needle 24" [60 cm] long or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: C4B = Slip next 2 stitches onto cable needle and leave at back of work. K2, then K2 from cable needle.
C4F = Slip next 2 stitches onto cable needle and leave at front of work. K2, then K2 from cable needle.
measurements: One size to fit baby 3-6 mos. Approx 27" [68.5 cm] long (excluding hood) x 14" [35.5 cm] wide
gauge: 21 sts and 40 rows = 4" [10 cm] in garter st.
instructions:
Note: Do not join. Work back and forth in rows across needle for all pieces.

BACK
Cast on 92 sts. 
Knit 2 rows.
Beg working in Cable Pat: See chart on page 3.
1st row:  (RS). K30. C4B. P2. K6. C4B. C4F. K6. P2. C4B. K30.
2nd and alt rows: K30. P4. K2. P20. K2. P4. K30.
3rd row: K34. P2. K4. C4B. K4. C4F. K4. P2. K34.
5th row: K30. C4B. P2. K2. C4B. K8. C4F. K2. P2. C4B. K30.
7th row: K34. P2. C4B. K12. C4F. P2. K34.
8th row: K30. P4. K2. P20. K2. P4. K30.
These 8 rows form Cable Pat.

CABLE KNIT BUNTING BAG  |  KNIT

Cont in Pat until work from beg measures approx 22" [56 cm], ending on a 3rd or 7th row. Next row: (WS). K4. *K3. K2tog. Rep from * to last 8 sts. K8. 76 sts. 
Work in garter st (knit every row) until work from beg measures 27" [68.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Cast off.

RIGHT FRONT
**Cast on 56 sts. 
Knit 2 rows.
Beg working in Cable Pat:
See chart on page 3.
1st row:  (RS). K12. C4B. P2. K6. C4B. C4F. K6. P2. C4B. K12.
2nd and alt rows: K12. P4. K2. P20. K2. P4. K12.
3rd row:  K16. P2. K4.  C4B. K4. C4F. K4. P2. K16.
5th row:  K12. C4B. P2. K2. C4B. K8. C4F. K2. P2. C4B. K12.
7th row:   K16. P2. C4B. K12. C4F. P2. K16.
8th row:  K12. P4. K2. P20. K2. P4. K12.
These 8 rows form Cable Pat. 
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 22" [56 cm], ending on a 3rd or 7th row.** 
Next row:  (WS). *K2. K2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 42 sts. 
Proceed in garter st (knit every row) until work from beg measures 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape neck: 1st row:  (RS). Cast off 3 sts. Knit to end of row. 39 sts. 
2nd row:  Knit.
Rep these 2 rows 6 times more.  
21 sts. 
Cont in garter st until work measures same length as Back, ending on a WS row. Cast off.

LEFT FRONT
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Front. 
Next row:  (WS). *K2. K2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 42 sts. 
Proceed in garter st (knit every row) until work from beg measures 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a RS row.
Shape neck: 1st row:  (WS). Cast off 3 sts. Knit to end of row. 39 sts. 
2nd row:  Knit.
Rep these 2 rows 6 times more.  
21 sts. 
Cont in garter st until work measures same length as Back, ending on a WS row. Cast off.

SLEEVES
Cast on 42 sts.
Work in garter st (knit every row) until work from beg measures 6½" [16.5 cm]. Cast off.

HOOD
Sew shoulder seams. 
With RS facing, pick up and knit 21 sts evenly up Right Front neck edge, 31 sts evenly across back neck edge (placing st marker on center back st) and 21 sts evenly down Left Front neck edge. 73 sts. 
Work in garter st (knit every row) until Hood from pick up edge measures approx 8 ½"  [21.5 cm] from pick up edge, ending on a WS row. Cast off. Fold cast off edge of Hood in half at marker and sew top Hood seam.

Button Band
With RS facing, pick up and knit 152 sts evenly up Right Front, 88 sts around Hood and 152 sts down Left Front. 392 sts. 
1st to 5th rows:  Knit. 
Place 16 markers for buttons on Button band, having top button at beg of neck shaping, bottom button 1" [2.5 cm] up from cast on edge and rem 14 buttons spaced evenly between. 
Work buttonholes to correspond to button markers on buttonhole band as follows:

6th row: (RS). *Knit to next marker. Cast off 2 sts. Rep from * 15 times more. Knit to end of row. 
7th row: Knit, casting on 2 sts over cast off sts. 
8th to 12th rows:  Knit. 
Cast off.

FINISHING
Place markers on side edges 4" [10 cm] down from shoulders. 
Sew in sleeves between markers. 
Sew side and sleeve seams. 
Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes. Sew bottom seam, overlapping button band.
